name: Mint Julep
about: The Mint Julep has been associated with Kentucky and the Kentucky Derby since the 1930s, but its origins date back to the late 18th century in the American South. It was originally prescribed as a medicine for stomach ailments.
instructions: Place mint leaves and simple syrup in a julep cup or rocks glass
Gently muddle to release the mint oils
Add crushed ice to fill half the glass
Stir until the glass is frosted on the outside
Add more crushed ice to form a mound on top
Garnish with a generous mint bouquet and dust with powdered sugar if desired
notes: A traditional julep should be served in a silver or pewter cup, which frosts over when filled with crushed ice. The outside of the cup is meant to be held, creating a refreshing experience during hot weather.
